title: Did you learn to type on a computer or typewriter and how old are you? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am 24 and learned to type with a neither Typewriter or Computer I used Hypnotype, an amazing software that requires zero practice. It is the only typing training software that uses Implicit Learning to increase typing speed. Implicit Learning (Remembering Patterns (e.g. Keyboard) by Repetitive Subconscious Exposure to the Pattern) - is how we learn all repetitive complex muscle memories as children - walking, talking, cycling etc. i.e. with no teaching Hypnotype was tested on 20 random Uni students in a Top Rated University. Please see (below and attached papers) for typing speed increases during the research. * 10 students improved by 30% with 30 hours over 5 weeks * 10 students improved by 43% with 30 hours over 6 1/2 weeks i.e. the more time and the longer the period spent using the software the bigger the improvement. FYI any user who wants to use the software will get a free key if they email before Jul 4.
I am 50. I learned to type on a computer, a Radio Shack TRS-80 that I got in 1977 when I was eleven.
I learnt how to type on a computer via when i was in grade , i got up to 60 wpm, decreased to 40 wpm, and now at age 14 i am up to 80–120 wpm.
